--- title: Validate IBM Cloud Account --- Steps to get set up as part of your team to do the MOOC ## Sign Up To participate in the [**Garage OpenShift and Cloud Pak MOOC**](https://www.onlinedigitallearning.com/course/view.php?id=5631), subscribe to the [**Garage OpenShift and Cloud Pak MOOC series**](https://ec.yourlearning.ibm.com/w3/subscription/series/10057053) to receive calendar invites for the MOOC events. **Warning:** If you do not enroll in the class, you will not be given access to the **MOOC** shared education sandbox cluster. Enrollment will enable you to be added to the development environment on the IBM Cloud. ### Notification After the first live webcast has completed, you will receive an email giving you details on how to access the Developer Tools environment for your development team. The email will specify the MOOC Sandbox Registration Details: - **Account**: This is the IBM Cloud account with a Developer Tools environment for your team and resources to perform the homework - **Team name**: This is the name of your development team, such as `mooc-team-one`, `mooc-team-two`,`mooc-team-n..` - **Git Organization**: This is the GitHub org for your team's set of git repos - **Resource Group**: This is the IBM Cloud resource group for your Developer Tools environment You must associate your IBM email address with your public GitHub account or make sure you have a public account that is using your IBM email address. - Go to [Github](https://github.com) - Log into your account or create one - Navigate to you account settings - Select emails, check your IBM email address is your primary email for the account - If it is not then add you IBM email and verify it - If you are correctly verified and associated you will receive a second email inviting you to your associated git organizations ![GitHub eMail](githubemail.png) **Warning:** If you do not associate your IBM email with you public GitHub account, you will have issues completing the homework. The Sandbox has been defined exactly how a client would use the IBM Cloud. Each development team will contain up to 30 of your Garage colleagues. Each team has been configured in [IAM](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/iam) as its own access group with a corresponding resource group. Your resources for your team's Developer Tools environment has been created in that resource group. So as a member of your team's access group, you'll have access to the resources in your team's Developer Tools environment. Since the Developer Tools environment has already been created, you will be restricted from creating new cloud resources or deleting existing ones. The following teams diagram helps to explain how access will be configured. Imagine you are the Green user: There will be lots of other users in your team, maybe in different timezones, all sharing the same cloud resources. The administrators will monitor the cluster to identify any issues early and resolve them. ![MOOC Teams](moocteams.png) You will be given access to the team's GitHub organization. You will be expected to create all of your Git projects as repositories in your team's organization. This is how real world development projects work. This will enable you to collaborate with your fellow team members and will prevent you from creating duplicate projects names. **Extra credit**: After performing the homework in the OpenShift cluster, can you get it working in a Kubernetes cluster as well? As shown in the teams diagram above, your team's Developer Tools environment and its resource group include not only an OpenShift cluster but also a Kubernetes cluster. It's helpful if you can perform these development tasks in both container platforms because some Garage clients use one and some use the other. If you can work in both, you'll be qualified to staff more projects. The Developer Tools environment makes the developer experience the same for both container platforms.

## Team Locations The teams are spread globally in different geographic locations listed below. We will try and make team membership as close to your home Garage as possible. **Note:** After you receive your team notification email, please click on the link to your team homework below to request to join your team's GitHub organization.

| Team | Location | Region | Data Center | Git Org | | --- | ------- | ------ | ---- | ----- |-------- | | **mooc-team-one** | Washington | us-east | wdc07 | [Washington Homework](https://github.com/mooc-team-one) | | **mooc-team-two** | London | eu-gb | lon05 | [London Homework](https://github.com/mooc-team-two) | | **mooc-team-three** | Tokyo | jp-tok | tok04 | [Tokyo Homework](https://github.com/mooc-team-three) | | **mooc-team-four** | San Jose | us-south | sjc04 | [San Jose Homework](https://github.com/mooc-team-four) | ![Team Locations](https://www.ibm.com/cloud-computing/images/bluemix/data-centers/030-Data-Center-Maps_1-0.png) ## Validating your access the IBM Cloud **Note**: If you have issues with any of the following steps, please raise an issue on the Slack channel **#openshift-cldpak-mooc**. All homework issues should be raised on the **#catalyst-project** channel. Follow these steps to check you can access your team's Developer Tools environment: - Login to the [IBM Cloud](https://cloud.ibm.com) - The MOOC Sandbox Registration Details email will tell you your account, team, Git organization, and resource group - In the IBM Cloud console, switch to the account specified in the email - Navigate to the *Resource List* - In the Group filter, select your resource group ![Resoure List](resourcelist.png) - Click on **Expand All** (top right) to show all of the resources in your resource group - Under Cluster, you should see two clusters named `mooc-NNN-rhos-cluster` and `mooc-NNN-iks-cluster` (where NNN is your team number) - In the Tags filter, enter `rhos` to see just the Red Hat OpenShift cluster and services ![Resoure List](devtoolsservices.png) - Click on the Red Hat OpenShift cluster to open its dashboard - Click on the **Access** tab - Follow the instructions to access the cluster from the command line , validate you are successful - Return to the cluster dashboard - Validate you can access the dashboards for each of the bound services - Click on the *Open Web Console* - Check that you can access the Red Hat OpenShift Console - Return to the **Resource List** - Remove the `rhos` tag and add the `iks` tag - Repeat the same steps for your teams IBM Kubernetes cluster and services If you have managed to access IBM Cloud account and open your teams Red Hat OpenShift Cluster and accessed the cluster from the command you have completed this homework task. ## Etiquette Please remember you will be using a development cluster with other colleagues, be considerate of the following rules: - Make sure you use your own namespace/project for you applications - Name your personal namespace/project using this convention `dev-{your initials}` ie. `dev-mjp` - Any namespaces/projects not following this approach will be deleted by the [master builders](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Um-PlX6oPBQ) - Add initials `{
